basics.name: Sayali Pingle
basics.label: MS Statistics @ Duke University | Ex- Data Scientist @ Fidelity Investments
basics.summary: AI Engineer/ Data Scientist with 2 years of experience in building large-scale scalable data-driven business solutions with a Master's in Statistics From Duke University.

work.name: Chess Tutor AI
highlights: Built LLM- Agentic RAG model with Langgraph and Deepseek to give Grandmaster level insight post chess game for 1K+ monthly users tailored to their level of chess understanding.
Cleaned large datasets of post-game chess analyses (>100K entries) using Pandas and NLP packages, building a structured database for training.
Optimized prompts with a modularized DSPy framework, incorporating Bootstrap Few-shot and chain-of-thought reasoning, resulting in a 35% improvement in response quality.
Designed testing framework using Pytest.

Researched and developed chess-specific evaluation metrics (e.g., strategic depth, threat awareness) and deployed a holistic evaluation pipeline to assess performance for response relevance and quality.
Analyzed user data and tailored responses to ELO ratings and play styles, achieving 15% increase in user satisfaction.

work.name: Fidelity Investments
highlights: Developed ‘Marble Chat’- a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) based ChatBot to aid in business research and detect profitable and sustainable investment options using LlamaIndex, Milvus DB, OpenAI API, saving 100+ hours of manual analysis with 0.5 sec of chatbot response time.

Built an automated data mining pipeline for 20+ websites for real-time financial data ingestion. Improved text data extraction accuracy by 30% using prompt optimization and parser customization to handle unstructured data.
Independently deployed an end-to-end scalable production pipeline to the cloud using Microsoft Azure and Docker.

work.name: Pangea Tech Solutions
highlights: Engineered a large-scale supply chain analytics dashboard using Databricks, PySpark, and PostgreSQL processing 30,000+ rows daily to monitor and forecast operations real-time, improved and developed new KPIs to enhance business performance , saving $75M in operational costs annually.
Streamlined Transport Efficiency by optimizing delivery truck routes and Identifying GPS black spots using geospatial data and google API leading to 10% reduction in carbon emission.
Implemented XgBoost to forecast truck delivery time (92.5% accuracy) reducing mean off-loading wait time by 10 hr.

Automated routine tasks by creating Python scripts for Data Quality and Data Validation checks reducing 8 hr work to 10 min runtime. Debugged and managed Data Pipelines with the Data Engineering team on Databricks Clusters.
Created Power BI dashboards as a blueprint for the computer science and UI/UX teams to replicate in the application, facilitating seamless data integration and user interface design.
Designed an overspeeding alert system to enhance truck driver safety, reduce transit damage, and lower vehicle insurance claims.
Fostered collaborative communication & presented data-driven business insights and recommendations to clients.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: Courses: Bayesian Statistics, Inferential Statistics, Deep Learning, Heirarchical Modeling, Probabilistic Machine learning, Algorithmic Trading, Math Finance, SQL, R programming, Open Source Programming
Extracurricular: Lead Instructor @ Duke Femmes, Women in Science and Engineering
Teaching Assistant: POLSCI 671: Applied Bayesian Modelling, STA 101: Inferential Statistics, COMPSCI 370: Intro to AI

education.institution: Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies
education.studyType: BSc in Applied Statistics and Analytics
courses: Courses: Hypothesis Testing, Estimation Theory, Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability Theory, Data Visualization (Tableau, Power BI, SAS VA), Multivariate Analysis using SPSS, Machine Learning, Marketing Analytics, RDBMS
Extracurricular: Lead R programming workshops, Head of Digital Communications @ Rotaract Club of NMIMS, Researcher @ E-cell

awards.title: State Finalist @ Regional Mathematics Olympiad
awards.summary: Received award from Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh and Qualified for INMO (Indian National Mathematics Olympiad).

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography
